Title: New Partner Integrations for Microsoft Fabric Unlocking AI and Analytics Opportunities
EnhancedContent:
Unlocking value with partner workloads for Microsoft Fabric and data unification integration for Microsoft OneLake.

Microsoft Ignite 2025 marks a pivotal moment for the Microsoft Fabric ecosystem, as we welcome a new wave of ISV partners whose integrations promise to redefine the boundaries of data analytics, AI, and business innovation. Building on the momentum from FabCon Europe, this event showcases not just the evolution of our platform, but the vibrant, collaborative spirit that makes Microsoft Fabric the engine for industry transformation. The latest ISV partners integrating their solutions with Microsoft Fabric and Microsoft OneLake – Fabric’s unified data lake -, highlight their unique innovations, and explore how these integrations are empowering organizations to unlock unprecedented value from their data.

![](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-98.png)Microsoft Fabric ISV Partners

## The Customer Value of Partner Workloads on Fabric

Partners continue to be catalysts for change, driving specialized solutions and accelerating digital transformation across industries. Their deep expertise and agile development cycles allow enterprises to tap into cutting-edge capabilities—whether it’s harnessing AI agents for complex automation, elevating data management, or unlocking new insights through graph analytics.

With Microsoft Fabric and Microsoft OneLake, the unified data lake for your entire organization, these new apps available via the Fabric Workload Hub are able to deliver new capabilities from better decisioning to AI data engineers to geospatial map experiences all seamlessly integrated for our users.

![](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-95.png)Workload Hub in MS Fabric

Let’s take a look at the most recent significant updates from our ISV partners.

### SAS Decision Builder (Generally Available)

SAS Decision Builder (GA), an app in Microsoft Fabric, helps organizations turn analytics into action. By connecting to OneLake and leveraging Fabric’s governance, it enables teams to design and deploy decision flows quickly in a secure, low-code environment. This accelerates real-time and batch decisions—such as faster loan approvals, smarter inventory planning, and optimized operations—driving agility and measurable business impact.

Learn more in the [Introduction to Decision Flows](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=10qQe6pUyjw) demo video.

![](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-99.png)SAS Decision Builder

### Esri ArcGIS Maps (Preview)

Esri brings advanced geospatial analytics to Fabric through ArcGIS Maps, enabling organizations to visualize and analyze location-based data directly within their analytics workflows. This integration helps businesses uncover spatial patterns, optimize logistics, and make smarter decisions with geographic context—all powered by Fabric’s unified data foundation. Combined with Esri’s recently announced [ArcGIS GeoAnalytics for Microsoft Fabric](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/data-engineering/spark-arcgis-geoanalytics), users can now also perform spatial analytics using Spark notebooks and Spark Job Definitions for Data Engineering and Data Science workloads.

![](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-100.png)Esri ArcGIS Maps

### Tonic Textual (Preview)

Tonic Textual allows users to anonymize sensitive data in OneLake while preserving its utility for analytics and AI. This enables organizations to maintain compliance and privacy without sacrificing innovation—accelerating secure data sharing and model development across teams.

Learn more in the [Tonic Textual: Transform sensitive text into AI-ready data on Microsoft Fabric](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Crw4yqtfSM) demo video.

![](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-101.png)Tonic Textual

## 2Test (Preview)

2TEST enables Microsoft Fabric users to define, test and measure the quality and compliance of their data residing in OneLake. 2TEST is tailored to meet all your user’s needs – business analysts can easily define data quality expectations and test business rules without programming expertise, and developers can write unit tests and integrate automated data checks into their workflows. Trusted, high-quality data in OneLake enables your analytics and AI projects to deliver value now.

![](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-102.png)2Test

## OneLake Zero-Copy Data Integrations

Microsoft OneLake unifies your data estate through strong interoperability in which partner solutions bring data in, storing them using open table formats like Apache Iceberg and Delta Lake, and partner engines securely query this data, without copying or duplicating data.

![](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-105.png)Unify data with OneLake

We are excited to announce major announcements with so many partners in this space. There are three in particular that I’d like to start out with: Snowflake, Databricks and SAP.

### Snowflake (Generally Available)

Snowflake users can now read and write data natively from Snowflake via the newly added Snowflake item in Fabric. Read more in my [blog](https://aka.ms/Snowflake-Ignite25)that goes into additional details.

![](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-106.png)Snowflake interop with OneLake

Databricks (Coming soon)

While mirroring of data from Databricks into OneLake is already available, reading OneLake data natively from Azure Databricks is coming soon for our users and will be available at the end of 2025. In addition, writing data directly from Databricks to OneLake is on the longer-term plan as well. Read more in this [blog](https://aka.ms/Azure-Databricks-Ignite25).

![](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-107.png)Databricks interop with OneLake

### SAP (Coming soon)

Similar to our other OneLake integrations, business data can also be unified using OneLake. We are excited about our announcement with SAP to do exactly this. Data from SAP is extremely valuable for our customers to get a 360-degree view of their business. Coming soon is also a zero-copy integration for our joint customers, without the need to move any data. Read more in theblog[here](https://aka.ms/SAPBDCConnect).

![](//dataplatformblogwebfd-d3h9cbawf0h8ecgf.b01.azurefd.net/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/image-108.png)SAP interop with OneLake

### ClickHouse (Generally Available)

[ClickHouse](https://clickhouse.com/) is a fast, open-source columnar database management system engineered for real-time data processing and analytics at scale. Self-managed ClickHouse and ClickHouse Cloud are now integrated with OneLake Table APIs, allowing direct querying of Iceberg tables, eliminating friction and unlocking unified, fast analytics across multiple sources.

Learn more about [ClickHouse integration with OneLake](http://www.clickhouse.com/blog/clickhouse-integrates-with-microsoft-onelake).

### Dremio (Generally Available)

[Dremio](https://www.dremio.com/)’s fully managed Lakehouse platform allows organizations to enable self-service analytics and AI quickly. Through OneLake Table APIs, Dremio users can now access tables stored in Apache Iceberg table format. With Dremio Cloud on Azure, customers no longer need to manage security, backup tasks, workload configuration and optimization, or manual debugging, freeing them to focus on analytics that move their business forward.

Try [Dremio with OneLake](https://docs.dremio.com/dremio-cloud/bring-data/connect/catalogs/iceberg-rest-catalog/#supported-configurations) today.

### PuppyGraph (Preview)

With [PuppyGraph](https://www.puppygraph.com/) on Azure, customers can query their relational and tabular data as a graph. PuppyGraph is now integrated with OneLake Table APIs enabling users to query Apache Iceberg tables as unified graph models that accelerate fraud detection in financial services, analyze complex security threats or optimize inventory and logistics in supply chains.

Learn more about [PuppyGraph with OneLake](https://docs.puppygraph.com/getting-started/querying-onelake-data-as-a-graph/), watch a [demo video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7nfWO1Mu4Yc) or follow along with the [getting started guide](https://docs.puppygraph.com/getting-started/querying-onelake-data-as-a-graph/).

### VeloDB (Preview)

[VeloDB](https://www.velodb.io/) is a modern real-time data warehouse for fast analytics on large scale data powered by Apache Doris. Customers of VeloDB and users of [Apache Doris](https://doris.apache.org/) can now preview the ability to connect and query [Apache Iceberg tables in OneLake](https://doris.apache.org/docs/3.x/lakehouse/best-practices/doris-onelake) using OneLake Table APIs. With this integration, users can combine real-time and batch analytics for blazing-fast, high concurrency and low latency analytics.

Learn how to [configur](https://www.velodb.io/blog/connect-apache-doris-and-microsoft-fabric-and-onelake)[e](https://www.velodb.io/blog/connect-apache-doris-and-microsoft-fabric-and-onelake)[OneLake with VeloDB](https://www.velodb.io/blog/connect-apache-doris-and-microsoft-fabric-and-onelake).

### EON (Preview)

[EON](https://www.eon.io/microsoft-azure) enables companies to turn their database backups into live, queryable data assets, eliminating the need for complex ETL and data replication pipelines. With this integration, EON managed database backups are now discoverable in OneLake and queryable using Microsoft Fabric and popular Apache Iceberg compatible engines. Furthermore, backups stored on other clouds like AWS and GCP are also queryable through EON’s support for OneLake Shortcuts.

### Telmai (Preview)

Telmai Data Reliability Agents continuously monitor, validate and enrich data in Microsoft OneLake, delivering high quality, trusted data to users and AI agents.  These agents allow users to query incidents, interpret anomalies, and deploy data monitors through plain language commands. With this integration, users can now connect with Telmai’s agents to analyze data in Microsoft OneLake – check out the [Ensuring Trusted, Autonomous-Ready Data in Microsoft OneLake with Telmai](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jO1fnjq2Yc0).

To learn more, refer to [Telmai’s integration with OneLake](https://www.telm.ai/blog/bringing-continuous-data-trust-to-microsoft-onelake-with-telmai/) and [get started](https://docs.telm.ai/telmai/connect-to-data/data-connections/azure-onelake) today.

### DevRev (Preview)

[DevRev](https://devrev.ai/) takes structured and unstructured data from existing systems and organizes it into a knowledge graph that powers conversational enterprise AI. DevRev Computer AirSync new integration allows customers to ingest enterprise data stored in OneLake into DevRev’s proprietary, permissions-aware knowledge graph. This creates a cross-application data hub and bridges business intelligence, analytics, customer operations, and product development, providing more context for AI solutions and unlocking new value for enterprises using Microsoft technologies. View the demo [here](https://youtu.be/f0L_4qWJHGo).

### TiDB (Preview)

TiDB is an open-source distributed MySQL-compatible database built for cloud-native, data-intensive, and AI-driven applications, popular across fintech, retail and gaming industries. With the new integration, users can now configure TiCDC to replicate data into Microsoft OneLake using [Open Mirroring](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/mirroring/open-mirroring).

Learn more about [TiDB replication architecture and how to get started](https://www.pingcap.com/blog/replicate-tidb-mirrored-database-microsoft-fabric-ticdc/).

## Looking Ahead: Partner Interoperability and Collaboration Opportunity

The announcements at Ignite are just the beginning. As our partner ecosystem grows, Fabric users can expect a steady stream of vertical solutions, AI-powered workflows, and innovative integrations. The partnership between Microsoft and its ISV community enablesorganizations to have access to best-in-class tools for data processing, analytics, and AI—empowering them to innovate confidently and at scale.

Stay tuned for more updates from Microsoft Fabric and our ISV partners. To learn more about these integrations and explore demos, visit the [Microsoft Fabric Blog](https://blog.fabric.microsoft.com/blog/) and [MS Ignite portal](https://ignite.microsoft.com/home)
Author: Microsoft Fabric Blog
